page.title: 18MAMMALS FOUND IN HOLBERROW
page.content:
The largest wild mammal regularly seen is the Badger. Badgers setts are visible on sunny banks around the area, the keuper marl seeming to allow good digging.
Foxes are common and still hunted in the area. Hares are seen on local farmland and rabbits are returning, some with myxomatosis again. Grey squirrels are common in local woodland although it is 40 years since red squirrels were seen in this area. Insects of particular interest include several species of dragonfly and damselfly, butterflies and moths.
Fish in the pond at Morton Underhill include Carp and Roach with the recent introduction of Tench. Grass snakes, frogs, toads and newts are also seen.
